intro: Narcissus pseudonarcissus var. grandiplenus, commonly known as the Giant Crowned Narcissus, is a variant of the common daffodil. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers with a prominent, white corona that is taller than the tepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring strap-like, grassy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in woodland edges or gardens. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its striking appearance.
